author: Catherine Flesh of Aurora
title: Hiding doors a challenge
text:
I deserve to win the home improvement package because my doors are so cheap and outdated that we keep them wide open so guests do not notice the doors' poor condition. Our home has eight doors like the ones in the photo, all made of hollow, hard plastic that try to imitate the look of wood. Their finish is faded and looks fake and the doorknobs are horribly ugly. One of the downstair doors has a hole because the plastic door was not strong enough to stop the impact of another doorknob. The laundry room has a cheap light imitation wood that I would also like to replace. I would love white, more contemporary and sturdy wooden doors with modern doorknobs. It would feel good to walk into my house and see a fresh, new look! Thank you for taking the time to consider my entry!
Design by HomeStory Chicago â€¢ Budget: $2,500-$5,000
HomeStory of Chicago would recommend replacing your dated, damaged doors with two-panel Roman Smooth Finish doors -- one of our most popular styles! This elegant and classy door style will transform the look and feel of your entire home. HomeStory's unique door replacement system allows us to digitally measure the existing doorway and custom cut a door to fit your existing doorframe. We can replace all the doors in your home in just a few hours with no construction mess or hassle. Our doors are factory painted with high grade Sherman-Williams paint, and we can provide you with paint color information to take to your local store to paint the walls and frames a matching or coordinating color. Add new knobs or levers and you will have a brand new hallway!
